title: Crash while patching (6.24)
body: This is the first time this ever happened to me, when the game patches to a certain percentage it sends me a message saying "the program has been force quitted due to an unknown error." I tried to reinstall the game, remove game_client or air_client, and nothing worked. My connection is perfectly fine as well. Please help me, thank you.

replies.body: Can you let me know which specific percentage this happens at?
Around 70%, between 70-80 is when this happens. I also forgot to mention that BugSpat is what sends me the error

Gotcha. So, failures at this particular point in patching are caused by your patcher disconnecting from the patching servers. The most common cause for this is problematic network settings that conflict with League. I'd like you to work through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to address the frequent fixes.

Let me know if this resolved your issue.
Hello, so, I gave it a try and it gave me logs, but I don't know wha to do with them? I need a little help with Hextech Fix

You don't need to do anything with the logs as of right now, you simply needed to run the tool so it could make changes to your DNS settings. At this point, I'd recommend running through the rest of the steps other than the Hextech step so you can ensure your local network settings are good.
Alright thanks, I'll give it a try
